brainly_data.question: Some poems about death mention God or religion, but Gray's "Elegy Written in a Country Churchyard" does not. Knowing that this poem is a romantic poem, why might Gray have chosen not to bring formal religion into it?
brainly_data.subject: English

all_answers.question: Some poems about death mention God or religion, but Gray's "Elegy Written in a Country Churchyard" does not. Knowing that this poem is a romantic poem, why might Gray have chosen not to bring formal religion into it?
all_answers.subject: English
all_answers.text: Because he originally wrote this this poem due to his best friends death which inspired him to write the poem in the first place
